Honey-Glazed Roasted Root Vegetables

Contributed by Grace Parisi
  • ACTIVE: 25 MIN
  • TOTAL TIME: 1 HR 30 MIN
  • SERVINGS: 12
  • •HEALTHY
  • •MAKE-AHEAD
  • •VEGETARIAN

The secret to this sweet, slightly tangy dish: the touch of sherry vinegar in the glaze.

 More Thanksgiving Side Dishes

Related Recipes

All-American Holiday Recipes

Celery Root

Healthy Winter Recipes For a Crowd

Holiday Vegetable Side Dishes

March Madness Recipes

Parsnips

Roasted Vegetables

Rosh Hashanah

Thanksgiving for a Crowd

Thanksgiving Vegetables

Paleo Thanksgiving Recipes

More ∨
  1. 1 1/4 pounds parsnips, peeled and sliced 1/2 inch thick
  2. 1 1/4 pounds carrots, peeled and sliced 1/2 inch thick
  3. One 1 1/4 pound celery root—peeled, quartered and sliced 1/2 inch thick
  4. 1 1/4 pounds golden beets, peeled and sliced 1/2 inch thick
  5. 1/2 cup extra-virgin olive oil
  6. 1/2 cup honey
  7. 6 thyme sprigs
  8. Salt and freshly ground pepper
  9. 2 tablespoons sherry vinegar
  1. Preheat the oven to 425°. In a large bowl, toss the root vegetables with the oil, honey and thyme and season with salt and pepper. Divide between 2 large, sturdy rimmed baking sheets. Cover with foil and roast for 40 minutes, shifting the pans once, until the vegetables are tender. Remove the foil and roast for 10 minutes longer, until glazed. Return them to the bowl and stir in the vinegar then season with salt and pepper. Serve right away.
Make Ahead The vegetables can be cooked early in the day and kept at room temperature before rewarming.
  • From Best Recipes of 2007: Perfect Vegetables, Thanksgiving in Your 20s, 40s, 60s
  • Published November 2007
